name: Java Moss
look: Java Moss is a small, dense, and bushy moss with dark green, thread-like fronds. It often forms a carpet or drapes over objects in the tank.
size: Up to 5-10 cm tall, spreading widely.
lighting: Low to medium lighting, can tolerate low light
fertilization: Occasional fertilization with micronutrients may help, but not strictly required.
maintenance: Low-maintenance; occasional trimming to prevent overgrowth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially peaceful species. Can provide hiding spots for fry and shrimps.

name: Christmas Moss
look: Christmas Moss has a rich, bright green color with unique branching patterns that resemble the shape of a Christmas tree, especially at the tips.
texture: Soft and fine, resembling other mosses.
size: Up to 5-10 cm tall, spreading across surfaces.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Beneficial to add liquid fertilizers with micronutrients, but not a must.
maintenance: Low to moderate maintenance; requires occasional trimming to maintain shape and prevent excessive growth.
tank_with_fish: Generally safe with most peaceful fish; provides hiding spots for small fish and invertebrates.

name: Duckweed
look: Duckweed consists of tiny, bright green, round leaves that float on the surface of the water. It often forms a dense carpet.
size: Leaves are typically 1-3 mm across, though it spreads quickly and covers the water's surface.
growth_rate: Very fast-growing, can quickly cover the tank surface.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting; prefers bright light for rapid growth.
fertilization: Responds well to nutrient-rich water, but too many nutrients can cause algae blooms.
maintenance: High-maintenance due to rapid growth; may require frequent thinning or removal.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish but can block light to other plants. Some fish, such as goldfish or certain cichlids, may eat it.

name: Java Fern
look: Java Fern has long, narrow, arching leaves with a deep green color. It forms a rosette shape and attaches to rocks or driftwood.
size: Typically grows 20-30 cm in height, depending on the variety.
lighting: Low to moderate lighting; can tolerate low light.
fertilization: Minimal fertilization required, can benefit from liquid fertilizer.
maintenance: Very low-maintenance; occasional trimming of old leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially peaceful species. Can be used to create hiding places for fry or smaller fish.

name: Najas
look: Najas has long, fine, and slender leaves that are often bright green. It forms bushy, dense clusters, particularly when allowed to float.
size: Can grow 30-60 cm tall when submerged, may float or spread across the water surface.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Occasional liquid fertilization can promote growth, especially for nutrient-hungry tanks.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; may require trimming to control its growth, especially when floating.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, but may compete for nutrients. Good for providing cover for fish.

name: Dwarf Hairgrass
look: Dwarf Hairgrass is a fine-leaved grass-like plant with bright green color, often used to create lush, carpeting effects in aquariums.
size: Can grow up to 5-10 cm tall in carpet form, spreads horizontally.
growth_rate: Moderate to fast-growing when conditions are ideal.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for a carpet effect.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization required, especially nitrogen and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; requires regular trimming to maintain carpet and prevent excessive growth.
tank_with_fish: Works well in tanks with fish that don’t uproot plants. Ideal for peaceful species.

name: Pygmy Chain Sword
look: Pygmy Chain Sword is a small, compact plant with narrow, sword-shaped leaves that form dense clusters.
size: Typically grows 5-10 cm in height, spreads out through runners.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Light to moderate fertilization with iron and trace elements.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming and management of runners.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially peaceful species. Can be used as ground cover.

name: Water Wisteria
look: Water Wisteria has broad, fern-like leaves that grow in a bushy or branching form. It has a bright green color with delicate texture.
size: Grows up to 30-60 cm in height.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for faster growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization required for optimal health.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming to maintain size and shape.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish and provides excellent cover for smaller fish or fry.

name: Vallisneria
look: Vallisneria has long, narrow leaves that grow in dense rosettes. The leaves are often wavy and can form an attractive backdrop in aquariums.
size: Typically grows 30-60 cm in height, but can reach even taller depending on variety.
lighting: Moderate lighting; can tolerate lower light conditions.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization with a focus on iron, potassium, and trace elements.
maintenance: Low to moderate maintenance; trimming required for size control.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially species that do not disturb plants. Can be used as background planting.

name: Marimo Moss Ball
look: Marimo Moss Balls are spherical, bright green algae balls that slowly grow and roll around the tank. They have a plush, mossy appearance.
texture: Soft and velvety to the touch.
size: Typically grows up to 5-10 cm in diameter, though it grows very slowly.
lighting: Low to moderate lighting.
fertilization: Minimal fertilization; occasional water changes may help.
maintenance: Low maintenance; requires occasional rolling to maintain shape.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; does not disturb tank dynamics. Also helps with water quality by absorbing excess nutrients.

name: Amazon Sword
look: Amazon Sword has large, broad, sword-shaped leaves that can form a dramatic background or midground plant. It has a deep green color and can develop reddish tones under ideal conditions.
size: Can grow 40-60 cm tall, and up to 30 cm wide.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Moderate to high fertilization, especially iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming and removal of older leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially larger peaceful species. Provides good hiding spots for smaller fish.

name: Hygrophila
look: Hygrophila has elongated, oval-shaped leaves that grow in dense bunches. The plant is usually bright green but can develop reddish tones in high light.
size: Typically grows 20-30 cm tall, can spread widely.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for optimal growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially potassium and iron.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; trimming is needed to control growth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most peaceful fish; good for providing hiding spots and oxygenation.

name: Giant Hairgrass
look: Giant Hairgrass has long, thin, grassy leaves that form dense clusters and grow tall. It has a light green color, and its upright growth creates a lush appearance.
size: Grows up to 30-60 cm tall, may spread across the substrate.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with nutrients like nitrogen and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; regular trimming and managing overgrowth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially larger peaceful species. Provides cover for fish and hides fry.

name: Riccia Fluitans
look: Riccia Fluitans is a floating moss-like plant with bright green, delicate, and small fronds. It forms floating mats that can be attached to hardscape or left floating.
size: Fronds can range from 1-5 cm, spreads across surfaces if attached.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with trace elements and iron.
maintenance: Moderate to high maintenance; requires frequent trimming and managing its spread.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, but it may block light to lower plants. Some fish, like goldfish, may disturb it.

name: Water Sprite
look: Water Sprite has bright green, feathery, finely divided leaves that give it a soft and bushy appearance. It forms a dense, lush growth in aquariums.
size: Typically grows 20-40 cm tall, but may spread more depending on the environment.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with nitrogen and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming to keep the plant from becoming too large.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; its bushy nature provides cover for small fish and fry.

name: Water Lettuce
look: Water Lettuce is a floating plant with rosettes of light green leaves resembling lettuce heads. It forms dense clusters at the water's surface.
size: Leaves typically 5-15 cm wide, can spread widely across the water surface.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for healthy growth.
fertilization: Light fertilization; nutrient-rich water encourages growth.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; frequent thinning and removal of excess plants.
tank_with_fish: Generally safe with most fish, though large or aggressive fish may disturb or eat it. Can provide surface cover for fish.

name: Anubias
look: Anubias is a hardy, slow-growing plant with thick, dark green, leathery leaves. It often forms a rosette shape and can be attached to rocks or driftwood.
size: Typically grows 10-30 cm tall, depending on the variety.
lighting: Low to moderate lighting; can tolerate low light.
fertilization: Minimal fertilization; occasional liquid fertilizers can promote growth.
maintenance: Very low maintenance; occasional leaf cleaning and detritus removal.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; perfect for tanks with slower-growing plants. Fish do not typically disturb it.

name: Lace Plant
look: The Lace Plant has intricately patterned, delicate leaves that give it a lace-like appearance. It has a striking, elegant look with fine, net-like veining.
size: Can grow up to 30-50 cm tall.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for the best display of colors.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, particularly with iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; requires occasional trimming to maintain shape.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, but its delicate leaves may be disturbed by larger, more aggressive species.

name: African Water Fern
look: The African Water Fern has large, deep green, rounded leaves that grow in a rosette shape, often forming a bushy appearance. The leaves have a leathery texture.
size: Can grow 20-40 cm tall.
lighting: Moderate lighting; tolerates low light conditions.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization; can benefit from occasional nutrient dosing.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming of old or dead leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, especially peaceful species. It can grow in lower light areas, making it ideal for shaded tanks.

name: Bacopa
look: Bacopa has small, rounded, bright green leaves that grow in a bushy, compact form. Some varieties develop reddish hues in high light.
size: Grows 20-40 cm tall, depending on variety.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for the best coloration.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization with a focus on potassium and iron.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming and cleaning of old leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most peaceful fish. Can be used as a background or midground plant.

name: Cabomba
look: Cabomba has finely dissected, feathery green leaves that grow in a bushy, branched form. It creates a dense, lush appearance, especially in the mid-to-background of aquariums.
size: Typically grows 30-50 cm tall.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for optimal growth.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate to high maintenance; requires regular trimming to prevent overgrowth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; provides dense cover for smaller fish or fry.

name: Cryptocoryne
look: Cryptocoryne has broad, arrow-shaped or wavy leaves that form rosettes. Its colors range from green to reddish hues, with some varieties showing intricate patterns.
size: Typically grows 15-30 cm tall, depending on the species.
lighting: Low to moderate lighting; some varieties may tolerate low light.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with micronutrients and iron.
maintenance: Low to moderate maintenance; occasional trimming and cleaning of dead leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, particularly peaceful species. Cryptocorynes are great for providing ground cover or mid-ground greenery.

name: Hornwort
look: Hornwort is a fast-growing, fine-leaved plant that forms bushy clusters. It has a bright green color and often floats freely in aquariums.
size: Can grow up to 50 cm or more if allowed to float.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting.
fertilization: Minimal fertilization required; may benefit from occasional micronutrient dosing.
maintenance: High-maintenance due to rapid growth; may need frequent thinning or removal.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; provides shelter for small fish and fry, but can become a floating nuisance in larger tanks.

name: Ludwigia
look: Ludwigia has broad, opposite leaves that range in color from green to red depending on light and nutrient conditions. It grows in a bushy, upright form.
size: Typically grows 20-40 cm tall.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for best coloration.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization with a focus on iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming and removal of old or damaged leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most peaceful fish, though its tender leaves may be disturbed by aggressive species.

name: Pogostemon
look: Pogostemon has long, narrow leaves that grow in whorls around a stem, giving the plant a bushy appearance. The leaves are bright green and often develop reddish hues in high light.
size: Typically grows 20-30 cm tall.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting for the best coloration.
fertilization: Moderate to high fertilization, especially iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; may require trimming to prevent excessive height and maintain shape.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, provides cover and oxygenation. Some species may nibble on leaves.

name: Red Ludwigia
look: Red Ludwigia is similar to Ludwigia but exhibits vibrant red to reddish-purple leaves under high light conditions. It creates a striking contrast in planted aquariums.
size: Typically grows 20-40 cm tall.
lighting: High lighting to encourage the red coloration.
fertilization: Moderate to high fertilization, particularly with iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; requires trimming to prevent overgrowth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, although larger fish may nibble on it. The plant's vibrant color is a highlight in planted tanks.

name: Rotala
look: Rotala is a group of plants with fine, narrow leaves that form dense, bushy clumps. The leaves are bright green to red, depending on the variety and lighting.
size: Typically grows 20-40 cm tall, but some varieties can grow larger.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting to encourage coloration.
fertilization: Moderate to high fertilization with a focus on iron and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; regular trimming to prevent overgrowth.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; provides excellent midground or background coverage.

name: Tiger Lotus
look: Tiger Lotus has large, round, and often reddish leaves with contrasting dark green markings. It grows with long, slender stems and can produce floating leaves on the surface.
size: Can grow up to 30-60 cm tall, with floating leaves reaching the water's surface.
lighting: Moderate to high lighting to achieve vibrant coloration.
fertilization: Moderate fertilization, especially with trace elements and potassium.
maintenance: Moderate maintenance; occasional trimming of older leaves.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish, though its larger size may block light to other plants. Ideal for larger tanks.

name: Fissidens Moss
look: Fissidens Moss is a delicate, cushion-like moss with a dense, velvety appearance. It forms a thick mat and can be attached to rocks or driftwood for a natural look.
size: Typically grows up to 3-5 cm tall, forming dense mats.
lighting: Low to moderate lighting for best growth.
fertilization: Minimal fertilization required; can benefit from occasional dosing with trace elements.
maintenance: Low maintenance; requires occasional cleaning of detritus from the surface.
tank_with_fish: Safe with most fish; provides excellent cover for small fish or fry. May be disturbed by larger, more aggressive fish.
